ðŸŒŸ langrepl | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Developing, running, and interacting with advanced LLM agents through an interactive command-line interface.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Deep Agent Architecture with planning tools, virtual filesystem, and sub-agent delegation â€¢ LangGraph Server Mode for running agents as API servers with visual debugging integration â€¢ Multi-Provider LLM Support (OpenAI, Anthropic, Google, AWS Bedrock, Ollama, etc.) â€¢ Multimodal Image Support via clipboard, drag-and-drop, or file paths
ðŸ“– Summary: Langrepl is an interactive command-line interface (CLI) application for building and running sophisticated LLM agents. It leverages LangChain, LangGraph, Prompt Toolkit, and Rich to provide a powerful environment for agent development and deployment.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ lsv | Rust
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: A fast, configurable, and feature-rich file browser for the terminal, enhancing productivity for developers and power users.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Three-pane navigation (parent/current/preview) â€¢ Keyboard-driven UX with multi-key sequences and which-key overlay â€¢ Lua configuration for themes, keymaps, actions, and programmable previewer â€¢ External command integration for captured output or interactive shells â€¢ File operations: add/rename/delete, multi-select with copy/move/paste
ðŸ“– Summary: lsv is a terminal-based file browser written in Rust, offering a three-pane interface for navigating directories and previewing files. It is highly configurable via Lua and supports rich, ANSI-colored previews from external tools.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ’¡ EternalVows | HTML
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Creating and hosting a personalized wedding website with event details, photos, and registry information.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Customizable, self-hosted wedding website template â€¢ Config-driven content via YAML or JSON â€¢ Dynamic background slideshow â€¢ Clean, modern single-page design â€¢ Smooth in-page navigation
ðŸ“– Summary: Eternal Vows is a lightweight, self-hosted wedding website template that allows users to easily customize and share all their event details through a simple YAML or JSON configuration file. It features a clean design, dynamic background slideshow, and smooth navigation, powered by a Node.js Express server.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸŒŸ howdy | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: To provide a seamless and secure facial recognition login and authentication experience on Linux systems, replacing traditional password entry.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Windows Hello-style facial authentication for Linux â€¢ Integration with PAM for system-wide authentication (login, lock screen, sudo, su) â€¢ Support for IR cameras and emitters â€¢ Packaged for Debian/Ubuntu, Arch Linux, Fedora, and openSUSE â€¢ Build from source option available
ðŸ“– Summary: Howdy is a Linux facial recognition authentication system that integrates with the Pluggable Authentication Modules (PAM) framework. It allows users to log in, lock their screens, and execute privileged commands using their face, mimicking the Windows Hello experience.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ aisheets | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Empowering users to create, enhance, and modify datasets using AI models without writing code, making AI-powered data manipulation accessible to a wider audience.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ No-code dataset building, enrichment, and transformation â€¢ Integration with thousands of open AI models from Hugging Face Hub â€¢ Support for custom and local LLMs via OpenAI API specification
ðŸ“– Summary: Hugging Face AI Sheets is an open-source, no-code tool for building, enriching, and transforming datasets using AI models. It allows users to leverage thousands of open models from the Hugging Face Hub or deploy custom LLMs compatible with the OpenAI API specification.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ digler | Go
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Forensic disk analysis and file recovery from disk images or raw devices.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Broad Disk Image and Raw Device Support â€¢ File System Agnostic Analysis â€¢ Plugin-Based Extensibility â€¢ Reporting Capabilities (DFXML) â€¢ Post-Scan Data Recovery
ðŸ“– Summary: Digler is a Go-based tool for digital forensics and data recovery, offering both a command-line interface and a desktop application. It specializes in analyzing disk images and raw devices to recover deleted files, even across different file systems, and supports custom file scanners via plugins.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source
